From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display configuration information related to hardware and software on the service module, use the **service-module wlan-ap status** command in privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: The interface number for the wireless device. Aways use 0.

Examples: The following example displays information for the wireless device on a Cisco Integrated Services Router:
Router#service-module wlan-ap 0 status Service Module is Cisco wlan-ap0
Service Module supports session via TTY line 2
Service Module is in Steady state
Service Module reset on error is disabled
Getting status from the Service Module, please wait..
System uptime = 0 days, 4 hours, 28 minutes, 5 seconds
Router#d was introduced for embedded wireless LAN access points on Cisco 860 and 880 Series Integrated Services Routers.
ExtraInfo: Use the **service-module wlan-ap status** command to•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Display the wireless device's software release version•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Check the wireless device's status (steady or down)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Display hardware information for the wireless device, including image, memory, interface, and system uptime

RelatedCmds.description: Enters wireless service module's console interface.
